parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "Slurm",
  "details": {
    "job_name": "run_OB1_simulations",
    "nodes": 1,
    "partition": "defq",
    "gpu": "A30",
    "gpu_count": 1,
    "walltime": "20:00:00",
    "email_type": "BEGIN,END",
    "email": "a.t.lopesrego@vu.nl",
    "modules": [
      "shared 2022",
      "PyTorch/1.12.1-foss-2021a-CUDA-11.3.1"
    ],
    "program": "python main.py",
    "program_arguments": [
      "../data/processed/Provo_Corpus.csv",
      "--number_of_simulations 100",
      "--experiment_parameters_filepath \"experiment_parameters_cloze.json\"",
      "--analyze_results \"True\"",
      "--eye_tracking_filepath '../data/raw/Provo_Corpus-Eyetracking_Data.csv'",
      "--results_identifier 'prediction_flag'"
    ],
    "program_arguments_gpt2": [
      "../data/processed/Provo_Corpus.csv",
      "--number_of_simulations 100",
      "--experiment_parameters_filepath \"experiment_parameters_gpt2.json\"",
      "--analyze_results \"True\"",
      "--eye_tracking_filepath '../data/raw/Provo_Corpus-Eyetracking_Data.csv'",
      "--results_identifier 'prediction_flag'"
    ],
    "program_arguments_llama": [
      "../data/processed/Provo_Corpus.csv",
      "--number_of_simulations 100",
      "--experiment_parameters_filepath \"experiment_parameters_llama.json\"",
      "--analyze_results \"True\"",
      "--eye_tracking_filepath '../data/raw/Provo_Corpus-Eyetracking_Data.csv'",
      "--results_identifier 'prediction_flag'"
    ],
    "working_directory": "$HOME/OB1-reader-model/src"
  }
}
```

This script utilizes the **Slurm** workload manager to run a series of Python scripts on a compute node. The script requests one node with a single A30 GPU and allocates 20 hours of wall time for the job.  It also sets up an email notification for the user at the beginning and end of the job.

The script then loads the necessary environment modules, including shared libraries and a specific version of PyTorch, and changes to the directory containing the "main.py" program. It then executes the program three times, each with different parameters for experiment configurations ("cloze," "gpt2," and "llama"). These commands use a Python script called "main.py" with different arguments to perform a simulation analysis on a dataset stored in "Provo_Corpus.csv." 

The script also uses a file "experiment_parameters_cloze.json" to load specific settings for the experiment. Finally, the script waits for all three processes to finish before exiting.
